answers.answer: You can't get in to see the ENT Specialist sooner?  I would ask them to call you as soon as they had a cancellation to get you in faster.Meanwhile continue the ear drops.

question: I am a relatively healthy 28 year old female living in the Northeast United States.  About two months ago I fainted 4 times within 15 minutes.  The first time I didn't lose consciousness completely.  The 2nd, 3rd, and 4th times I completely blacked out and didn't know what was going on the 4th time was in the vestibule of the emergency room.  I couldn't breath and my lips turned blue.  I was blood and urine tested for pregnancy, infection, dehydration, thyroid, and glucose levels.  I was given a EKG and an Echo-cardiogram, as well as a chest x-ray.  I was told that I didn't have a heart, or lung condition and that I wasn't dehydrated, didn't have an over or under active thyroid, and didn't have any type of infection, diabetes or dehydration.  I had heart palpitations, headache, rapid pulse, and nausea.  At the time the only medications I had were Flonase and Benadryl for allergies.  I am currently still taking the Flonase, as well as 50mg of Zoloft daily.  The fainting hasn't happened again but I have felt like I was going to faint.  I felt faint last night.  Also I have had 4 ear infections in as many months. The nausea comes and goes but I feel that I may be getting the 5th ear infection right now.  It feels like someone jamming sharpened pencils in my ears, mainly the left but sometimes both.  I feel an intense pressure in my head sometimes, and often feel dizzy. I also feel a leaking feeling in my head not on it like my brain is dripping.  Sometimes there is liquid in my ear.  I had 2 ear infections both inner and outer in one ear and an outer in the other. I have an appointment with an ENT but they are booked until mid October.  Should I wait and just continue using the benzocaine drops to get me through the pain or insist to see someone else?  I'm already a hypochondriac, and this testing with no answers is making me worry more.
title: Doctor could not find the cause should I worry?
